medical_history.chief_complaint: Classical symptoms of vitamin D deficiency and associated rickets.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in early childhood for both siblings. Patient 1 first presented at age 10 with short stature and generalized bone pain. Patient 2 presented at age 14.7 with severe progressive bowing of the lower limbs, generalized bone pain, and difficulty walking, initially noted at age 5. Both conditions improved with vitamin D therapy but relapsed upon discontinuation of supplementation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both patients demonstrated a history of vitamin D deficiency and related rickets. Patient 2 underwent surgical correction of lower limb bowing.
medical_history.family_history: Inheritance pattern indicative of an autosomal recessive disorder; both siblings are compound heterozygotes for two previously undescribed mutations in the CYP2R1 gene, inherited from both parents.
